event.title: was captured by Israel during the 1948

data.event: It was captured by Israel during the 1948 Arab–Israeli War.

According to the Arab geographer Mujir al-Din (1456–1522), the village was home to the Muslim scholar sheikh Yusuf al-Barbarawi, a local sage and a student of renowned scolar Ahmad ibn Dawud, who died in 1323.
The village appeared under the name of Hababeh on the map that Pierre Jacotin compiled in 1799.
